references.paper_title: Calibrating noise to sensitivity in private data analysis
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces the concept of differential privacy, the core privacy concept on which the current paper builds.

references.paper_title: Differentially private sparse vectors with low error, optimal space, and fast access
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art differentially private mechanism for sparse vectors, providing a strong comparison point for the new method in terms of privacy-utility tradeoffs and space usage.

references.paper_title: Improved utility analysis of private countsketch
references.reason: This work provides an improved theoretical analysis of count-sketch, a related data structure used for private data release, which helps in understanding the limitations of existing techniques and enables a fair comparison with the new approach.

references.paper_title: Near-Optimal oblivious Key-Value stores for efficient PSI, PSU and Volume-Hiding Multi-Maps
references.reason: This paper introduces new linear system techniques that inspire the new differentially private set representation approach; its constructions and analysis directly inform the methods in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Efficient Gauss elimination for near-quadratic matrices with one short random block per row, with applications
references.reason: This paper provides the underlying linear system construction (random band matrices) that enables the pure differentially private variant of the proposed mechanism; its efficient solving algorithm is crucial to the practicality of the approach.
